00022 /* This header defines a number of "unsafe" operations on Chipmunk objects.
00023  * In this case "unsafe" is referring to operations which may reduce the
00024  * physical accuracy or numerical stability of the simulation, but will not
00025  * cause crashes.
00026  *
00027  * The prime example is mutating collision shapes. Chipmunk does not support
00028  * this directly. Mutating shapes using this API will caused objects in contact
00029  * to be pushed apart using Chipmunk's overlap solver, but not using real
00030  * persistent velocities. Probably not what you meant, but perhaps close enough.
00031  */
00032 
00033 /// @defgroup unsafe Chipmunk Unsafe Shape Operations
00034 /// These functions are used for mutating collision shapes.
00035 /// Chipmunk does not have any way to get velocity information on changing shapes,
00036 /// so the results will be unrealistic. You must explicity include the chipmunk_unsafe.h header to use them.
00037 /// @{
00038 
00039 #ifndef CHIPMUNK_UNSAFE_HEADER
00040 #define CHIPMUNK_UNSAFE_HEADER
00041 
00042 #ifdef __cplusplus
00043 extern "C" {
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 /// Set the radius of a circle shape.
00047 void cpCircleShapeSetRadius(cpShape *shape, cpFloat radius);
00048 /// Set the offset of a circle shape.
00049 void cpCircleShapeSetOffset(cpShape *shape, cpVect offset);
00050 
00051 /// Set the endpoints of a segment shape.
00052 void cpSegmentShapeSetEndpoints(cpShape *shape, cpVect a, cpVect b);
00053 /// Set the radius of a segment shape.
00054 void cpSegmentShapeSetRadius(cpShape *shape, cpFloat radius);
00055 
00056 /// Set the vertexes of a poly shape.
00057 void cpPolyShapeSetVerts(cpShape *shape, int numVerts, cpVect *verts, cpVect offset);
00058 
00059 #ifdef __cplusplus
00060 }
00061 #endif
00062 #endif
00063 /// @}
